enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Registration is reserved for EARTH majors & minors and ENVR_SCI majors & minors.
title: WCAS EARTH 201-0-01 Earth Systems Revealed
class_attributes:
Natural Sciences Distro Area

See Class Details for Important Registration Info

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Introduction to Physical Geology: The study of Earth systems and their interactions. This course will approach the study of Earth systems from two perspectives: 1) description and classification of Earth's features, including Earth materials, internal structure, and landforms and 2) description and explanation of the physical, chemical and biological processes that form and modify these features.
Topics include minerals; sedimentary, igneous, and metamorphic rocks; the interior Earth, oceans, and atmosphere; solid Earth processes, such as volcanism, seismicity, and plate tectonics and their interactions with the atmosphere and hydrosphere to drive surface Earth processes, such as climate, weathering, and glaciation; geologic time; global change.

This course includes a mandatory field trip to Baraboo, Wisconsin

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Two REQUIRED Textbooks: 1) Earth: An Introduction to Physical Geology, 12th Edition. ISBN13: 9780134074252. https://www.pearsonhighered.com/product/Tarbuck-Earth-An-Introduction-to-Physical-Geology-12th-Edition/9780134074252.html (approx. $160 to purchase new, $60 to rent) 2) Laboratory Manual in Physical Geology, 11th Edition. ISBN13: 9780134446608. (approx. $100 to purchase new, $90 to rent) https://www.pearsonhighered.com/product/American-Geological-Institute-Laboratory-Manual-in-Physical-Geology-11th-Edition/9780134446608.html

This course also includes a mandatory trip to Baraboo, Wisconsin. All costs for the trip are paid by the university.
